materials.raw_text: Co: 25 g, Er: 25 g, Hg: 5 g, Tm: 35 g

sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt powder) - Purchase from a chemical supply store; Er (Erbium powder) - Obtain from a rare earth metal supplier; Hg (Mercury) - Acquire from a licensed chemical supplier; Tm (Thulium powder) - Source from a rare earth metal supplier.
steps: Co (Cobalt powder) - Purchase from a chemical supply store; Er (Erbium powder) - Obtain from a rare earth metal supplier; Hg (Mercury) - Acquire from a licensed chemical supplier; Tm (Thulium powder) - Source from a rare earth metal supplier.

1. Weigh out 25 g of cobalt powder, 25 g of erbium powder, 5 g of mercury, and 35 g of thulium powder using an analytical balance. 2. Combine the powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a spatula to mix the powders thoroughly for 10 minutes to ensure a uniform blend. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a ball mill for an additional 30 minutes of milling to achieve a fine homogeneous mixture.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 25 g of cobalt powder, 25 g of erbium powder, 5 g of mercury, and 35 g of thulium powder using an analytical balance. 2. Combine the powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a spatula to mix the powders thoroughly for 10 minutes to ensure a uniform blend. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a ball mill for an additional 30 minutes of milling to achieve a fine homogeneous mixture.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a ceramic crucible. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to facilitate solid-state reaction and densification.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a ceramic crucible. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to facilitate solid-state reaction and densification.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C) over a period of 6 hours. 2. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C) over a period of 6 hours. 2. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace.

steps: 1. Inspect the solid sample for any surface imperfections. 2. If necessary, use sandpaper (grit 400) to smooth out any rough edges gently. 3. Optionally, apply a coat of suitable sealing agent to enhance surface durability. 4. Allow the sealing agent to dry for at least 24 hours before handling the final product.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Inspect the solid sample for any surface imperfections. 2. If necessary, use sandpaper (grit 400) to smooth out any rough edges gently. 3. Optionally, apply a coat of suitable sealing agent to enhance surface durability. 4. Allow the sealing agent to dry for at least 24 hours before handling the final product.
